page.title: 02DRAWDYKES CASTLE
page.content: Formely the home of the Aglionby family from the time of the conqueror. The original castle was built from materials of the Roman wall.In the 17th century it was nearly all taken down and rebuilt by John Aglionby , the then recorder of Carlisle. He placed the 3 large carved heads on the parapets-probably Roman. In 1765 the original building was taken down and the present farm house built.Many Roman inscriptions have been found and one says "DIS MANIBUS MARCI TROAINI AUGUSTNI AMMILLUSFMA CONIUX KARISS (IMA).The translation is "to the spirits of the departed and of Marcus Troianus Augustinus. His dearest wife Aelia Ammillusima had this tombstone set up". The castle is now derelict but Mrs Hammond lives at the farm by Drawdykes castle. by S Khawam C Stratton
